channel.title: CyberNetSec - Policy and Compliance
channel.description: Latest policy and compliance threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: G7 Urges Financial Sector to Prepare for Quantum Computing Threat
item.description:
The G7 Cyber Expert Group (CEG), co-chaired by the U.S. Department of the Treasury and the Bank of England, has issued a public statement and roadmap advising the global financial sector to begin a coordinated transition to quantum-resilient technology. The guidance warns that advanced quantum compu...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

item.title: Cyber-Fraud Now Top Global Threat, Surpassing Ransomware, WEF Report Finds
item.description:
The World Economic Forum's (WEF) 'Global Cybersecurity Outlook 2026' report, produced with Accenture, reveals a major shift in the threat landscape: cyber-enabled fraud and phishing have now surpassed ransomware as the top concern for global business leaders. The report highlights that fraud has rea...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Threat Intelligence, Regulatory

item.title: Financial Sector Warned of Systemic Supply Chain Risk and 'Indirect Ransomware'
item.description:
A new threat intelligence report for 2025-2026 reveals a perilous cyber landscape for the financial sector, dominated by systemic supply chain risks and evolving ransomware tactics. Citing data that 97% of U.S. banks were breached via third-party suppliers in 2024, the report underscores the critica...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Supply Chain Attack, Policy and Compliance

item.title: Illinois DHS Exposes Data of 700,000 Residents in Massive Misconfiguration Breach
item.description:
The Illinois Department of Human Services (IDHS) has disclosed a major data breach affecting approximately 705,000 state residents. The breach was caused by incorrect privacy settings on internal planning maps that were inadvertently made public on a mapping website for up to four years. The exposed...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: Chinese State Hackers 'Salt Typhoon' Breach U.S. Congressional Committee Emails
item.description:
The Chinese state-sponsored hacking group known as Salt Typhoon has reportedly compromised the email systems of staff members for several key U.S. House of Representatives committees. The cyberespionage campaign, detected in December 2025, targeted aides on influential panels including those oversee...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Policy and Compliance

item.title: FBI: North Korea's Kimsuky APT Using 'Quishing' to Bypass MFA
item.description:
The U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has issued a formal advisory warning that the North Korean state-sponsored threat group Kimsuky (also known as APT43) is actively using malicious QR codes in spear-phishing emails. This tactic, dubbed 'quishing,' is designed to bypass traditional email ...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Threat Actor, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: NIST Releases Draft Cybersecurity Framework Profile for AI
item.description:
The U.S. National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) has released a preliminary draft of a Cybersecurity Framework (CSF) Profile for Artificial Intelligence. This new guidance, intended to be used with CSF 2.0 and the AI Risk Management Framework (AI RMF), aims to help organizations manage...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory

item.title: New Privacy & Cybersecurity Laws Take Effect Across US States
item.description:
January 1, 2026, marked the effective date for a significant wave of new state-level privacy and cybersecurity laws in the United States. Comprehensive privacy laws are now active in Indiana, Kentucky, and Rhode Island. Concurrently, new regulations under the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) c...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory

item.title: Report: AI-Powered Social Engineering and Identity Attacks Dominated 2025
item.description:
The 2025 Threat-Led Defense Report from Tidal Cyber reveals a significant shift in the threat landscape, where attackers are adapting faster than security defenses. Key trends from 2025 include the widespread adoption of AI to automate and scale highly convincing social engineering campaigns, and a ...

item.title: Software Supply Chain Attacks Doubled in 2025, Report Finds
item.description:
A year-end security analysis published on December 29, 2025, reveals that software supply chain attacks more than doubled globally in 2025, with associated losses projected to reach $60 billion. The report, from CleanStart, indicates that this has become a systemic risk, with over 70% of organizatio...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Policy and Compliance, Threat Intelligence
